Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; APPLICATION
Name: Cylix
Description: A cylix with a straight rim, set off by means of a deep groove, a bitruncate cone-shaped body with thin walls and a bottom with a solid foot. Orangey-coloured paste. The upper half of the exterior surface is covered with a reddish chestnut-coloured coating and bears a decoration of spatting, consisting of drops distributed over three parallel horizontal bands of a light cream colour.
